thread.title: In a world ... where Michael Jordan can't sell his house
thread.title_full: In a world ... where Michael Jordan can't sell his house - Chicago Tribune

author: Phil Thompson
title: In a world ... where Michael Jordan can't sell his house
text:
Michael Jordan, or more accurately, his real estate agent, is giving new meaning to the term "home theater."
See, Jordan has been trying to sell his 56,000-square-foot mansion in Highland Park since 2012, cutting it down periodically from its original listing at $29 million before settling on his latest asking price -- $14.9 million -- in May.
Still, no one's biting. So luxury real estate agent Kofi Nartey has upped the ante and given the home the Hollywood treatment, narrating sweeping visuals of Jordan's estate, all to epic-sounding violins, in two videos.
In one called "I AM..." Nartey personalizes the house as if it were an extension of Jordan's trash-talking ego: "You call yourself a trophy property; a mansion? (Laughs) Let me show you something. You think you're big? Well, I'm bigger."
"I AM..." The Michael Jordan estate One of two trailers gives a visual tour of Michael Jordan's Highland Park mansion.
One of two trailers gives a visual tour of Michael Jordan's Highland Park mansion.
See more videos He appeals to the hardcore (and well-to-do) MJ fan out there in "ONLY ONE."
"The name Jordan is synonymous with success. How many times have you heard he is the Michael Jordan of this or she is the Michael Jordan of that ... well this is the Michael Jordan of homes because this is Michael Jordan's home."
Later he adds: "Only one person will own a piece of history. Only one person will be able to say, 'I just bought Michael Jordan's house. Will it be you?"
That last line sounds eerily familiar .
Michael Jordan asks "Is It In You?" Outtakes from MIchael Jordan's Gatorade commercial.
Outtakes from MIchael Jordan's Gatorade commercial.
